intro: Setilobus, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lobed or divided, giving them their scientific name. They produce small, yellow or orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Setilobus species are often found in grasslands and open habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
